pr_title: Prune Eth1DataCache based on latest block timestamp

timeline.message: Prune Eth1DataCache based on latest block timestamp rather than tick or slot events.

timeline.bodyText: This one I do not understand the reasoning well but I do get that a buffer is necessary anyway.
timeline.author: cemozerr

replies.bodyText: The validator APIs allow the validator to specify the slot they need to create a block for, so there's no guarantee that the block we're building is at our current node slot - it could be somewhere before that (or after but that doesn't affect this).
replies.author: ajsutton

timeline.bodyText: I think this only needs to be 1 * ETH1_FOLLOW_DISTANCE prior, because the latest block events coming from Eth1DataManager already have time, t = (t - (Eth1 Follow Distance Time) + Request Buffer))
timeline.author: cemozerr
